data.enText: the condition of the atmosphere at a particular place and time, such as the temperature, and if there is wind, rain, sun, etc.
hot/cold/wet/fine/summer/windy, etc. weather
data.chText: 炎热、寒冷、雨雪、晴朗、夏天、刮风等的天气

data.enText: Did you have good weather on your trip?
I'm not going out in this weather!
data.chText: 这种天气我不会出门的！

data.enText: There's going to be a change in the weather .
if the weather holds/breaks (= if the good weather continues/changes)
data.chText: 如果天气还是这么好 / 变坏

data.enText: The weather is very changeable at the moment.
‘Are you going to the beach tomorrow?’ ‘It depends on the weather.’
data.chText: “你明天打算去海滩吗？”“那要看天气而定。”

data.enText: We'll have the party outside, weather permitting (= if it doesn't rain) .
data.chText: 天气允许的话，我们就在室外举行这次聚会。

data.enText: a weather map/chart
a weather report
a report of what the weather will be like, that is on the radio or television, or in the newspapers
to listen to the weather
in all weathers
in all kinds of weather, good and bad
data.chText: 不论天气好坏；风雨无阻

data.enText: She goes out jogging in all weathers.
data.chText: 无论天气好坏，她都出去慢跑锻炼。

data.enText: keep a weather eye on sb/sth
to watch sb/sth carefully in case you need to take action
data.chText: 对…随时留意；对…小心提防

data.enText: under the weather
if you are or feel under the weather , you feel slightly ill/sick and not as well as usual
brass monkeys
brass monkey weather
if you say that it is brass monkeys or brass monkey weather , you mean that it is very cold weather
make heavy weather of sth
to seem to find sth more difficult or complicated than it needs to be
to change, or make sth change, colour or shape because of the effect of the sun, rain or wind
data.chText: （因受风吹、日晒、雨淋等，使）退色，变色，变形

data.enText: This brick weathers to a warm pinkish-brown colour.
data.chText: 这块砖经日晒雨淋退成了带粉红的暖褐色。

data.enText: Her face was weathered by the sun.
to come safely through a difficult period or experience
data.chText: 经受住，平安地渡过（困难）

data.enText: The company just managed to weather the recession.
data.chText: 这家公司勉强渡过了衰退期。

data.enText: She refuses to resign, intending to weather the storm (= wait until the situation improves again) .
data.chText: 她拒绝辞职，想要经受住这次风暴的考验。

data.text: types of weather表示天气的词

data.enText: Rain
Drizzle is fine light rain.
A shower is a short period of rain.
A downpour or a cloudburst is a heavy fall of rain that often starts suddenly.
When it is raining very hard you can say that it is pouring . In informal BrE you can also say that it is bucketing down or chucking it down . You can also say: The heavens opened.
data.chText: 大雨倾盆可用pouring，非正式英国英语亦可用bucketing down或chucking it down。还可说The heavens opened。

data.enText: Storms
A cyclone and a typhoon are types of violent tropical storms with very strong winds.
A hurricane has very strong winds and is usually at sea.
A monsoon is a period of very heavy rain in particular countries, or the wind that brings this rain.
data.chText: monsoon指某些国家的雨季、季节性暴雨或带来暴雨的季风。

data.enText: A squall is a sudden strong, violent wind, usually in a rain or snow storm.
data.chText: squall指在暴风雨或暴风雪中突起的飑。

data.enText: A tornado (or twister informal ) has very strong winds which move in a circle, often with a long narrow cloud.
data.chText: tornado（或非正式用语twister）指龙卷风。

data.enText: A whirlwind moves very fast in a spinning movement and causes a lot of damage.
A blizzard is a snow storm with very strong winds.
Tempest is used mainly in literary language to describe a violent storm.
data.chText: tempest主要为文学用语，指暴风雨、风暴、暴风雪。

means: 恶劣天气，刮风（天气），暴雨（天气）
（因受风吹、日晒、雨淋等，使）退色，变色，变形
经受住，平安地渡过（困难）
使（屋面等）倾斜（以利排去雨水）

ex.enText: He was not used to the local climate.
For most of the year, we have a dry climate in Beijing.
ex.chText: 一年中大部分时间，北京的气候都很干燥。

ex.enText: The climate in this region is unwholesome.
ex.chText: 这个地区的气候于健康不利。

synonyms.bx: 指某一地区常年的气候情况，包括气温、干旱程度、降雨量等。

ex.enText: What was the weather like on your vacation?
ex.chText: 你们去度假时天气怎么样？

ex.enText: You should go outdoors in such fine weather.
ex.chText: 天气这么好，你真该到户外去走一走。

synonyms.bx: 通常指某一地区短期内具体的气象变化，包括晴雨寒暖等情况。

data.enText: in all weathers
in all kinds of weather, good and bad
data.chText: 不论天气好坏；风雨无阻

data.enText: She goes out jogging in all weathers.
data.chText: 无论天气好坏，她都出去慢跑锻炼。

data.enText: keep a weather eye on sb/sth
to watch sb/sth carefully in case you need to take action
data.chText: 对…随时留意；对…小心提防

data.enText: under the weather
if you are or feel under the weather , you feel slightly ill/sick and not as well as usual
brass monkeys
brass monkey weather
if you say that it is brass monkeys or brass monkey weather , you mean that it is very cold weather
make heavy weather of sth
to seem to find sth more difficult or complicated than it needs to be

tr: the atmospheric conditions that comprise the state of the atmosphere in terms of temperature and wind and clouds and precipitation
example: they were hoping for good weather
every day we have weather conditions and yesterday was no exception
the conditions were too rainy for playing in the snow

tr: change under the action or influence of the weather

example.ex: Fishing is possible in virtually any weather.
example.tran: 几乎任何天气里都可以钓鱼。

defx.def: If you say that someone does something in all weathers, you mean that they do it regularly whether the weather is good or bad.
defx.tran: 无论天气好坏;风雨无阻

example.ex: They go out in all weathers.
example.tran: 无论天气好坏他们都会外出。

value.def: The weather is the condition of the atmosphere in one area at a particular time, for example if it is raining, hot, or windy.

example.ex: Unpainted wooden furniture weathers to a grey colour...
example.tran: 没有上漆的木制家具会褪成灰色。

example.ex: This rock has been weathered and eroded.
example.tran: 这块岩石经风吹日晒已被侵蚀。

value.def: If something such as wood or rock weathers or is weathered, it changes colour or shape as a result of the wind, sun, rain, or cold.

example.ex: The facade of the building was a little weathered...
The man had a worn, weathered face.
example.tran: 这个男人有张饱经沧桑的脸。

example.ex: The company has weathered the recession...
example.tran: 这家公司从经济萧条中挺了过来。

example.ex: The government has weathered its worst political crisis.
example.tran: 政府平安度过了其最严重的政治危机。

value.def: If you weather a difficult time or a difficult situation, you survive it and are able to continue normally after it has passed or ended.

example.ex: Street committees keep a weather eye on the families in their district.
example.tran: 街道委员会留意所辖区域内的家家户户。

value.def: If you keep a weather eye on someone or something, you stay alert so that you will notice if anything unpleasant happens.
value.tran: 警惕;密切注意；留心观察

example.ex: Some of the riders in this section made heavy weather of the cross-country race.
example.tran: 这个环节的部分骑手夸大了这场越野比赛的困难。

value.def: If you say that someone is making heavy weather of a task, you are critical of them because they are doing it in an inefficient way and are making it seem more difficult than it really is.
value.tran: 夸大…的困难；对…小题大做

example.ex: I was still feeling a bit under the weather.
example.tran: 我仍觉得身体有些不舒服。

value.def: If you say that you are under the weather, you mean that you feel slightly ill.
